comment.author: 35468143183@N01
comment._content: Wonderful portrait. This man is clearly not to be trifled with.

comment.author: 46696233@N00
comment._content: According to www.militarymuseum.org/Greely.html Col. A. C. Sharpe was with the 30th Infantry. And a reference in books.google.com/books?id=c1kBAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA386&l... indicates he was the author of a textbook called "Making A Soldier"

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Colonel Sharpe was photographed in August, 1911, at Camp Perry, Ohio, where he was attending the National Military Rifle Championship contests. A story about the marksmanship contests, from The New York Times, August 26, 1911: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9F01EEDB1531E2...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of Colonel A. C. Sharpe, in his tent at Camp Perry, Ohio:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162719777/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Colonel C. B. Winders was another participant in the National Military Rifle Championship contests at Camp Perry, Ohio, in August, 1911:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163527112/]
